page.title: 01Introduction to Stowmarket
page.content: Stowmarket is a busy market town set in fertile, undulating countryside. The A45 and the railway carry people and goods through it on a large scale. Although some residents work as far afield as London, many are employed locally, either by large multi-national companies or by small indigenous concerns. Stowmarket is expanding. It has already linked up with the village of Combs and is sprawling towards Stowupland and Onehouse. This has overloaded some roads and there are plans to reduce congestion in the town centre. This area does not display extremes of wealth and poverty. There is a mixture of council and privately-owned housing. Brick and tile are the dominant building materials. Flint is infrequently used.
